name: Mudaraba: Profit-Sharing Ratio (Hard Gate)
description: HARD GATE: Profit-sharing ratio must be determined as a percentage of profit (not fixed amount) and agreed upfront. Cannot be 100% to one party.

steps.title: Determine Profit-Sharing Ratio
steps.description: Negotiate and determine profit-sharing percentage between Rab al-Mal (capital provider) and Mudarib (entrepreneur/manager)

requiredEvidence.description: Market comparison of profit-sharing ratios for similar Mudaraba structures
Rationale for proposed ratio based on risk, effort, and market practice

policyConstraints.constraint: Profit-sharing must be expressed as PERCENTAGE of profit, not fixed amount
CRITICAL: Neither party can receive 100% of profits - both must share

steps.title: Validate Shariah Compliance of Ratio
steps.description: Shariah Compliance Officer verifies that profit-sharing ratio complies with FAS-3 requirements

requiredEvidence.description: SCO verification that ratio is percentage-based and shared by both parties
Confirmation that ratio structure meets AAOIFI FAS-3 §3 requirements

policyConstraints.constraint: Profit-sharing ratio must be clearly stated in Mudaraba agreement
Fixed guaranteed return to Rab al-Mal is PROHIBITED - violates Mudaraba essence

steps.title: Document in Mudaraba Agreement
steps.description: Clearly document profit-sharing ratio in Mudaraba contract with explicit percentage allocation

requiredEvidence.description: Contract explicitly stating: 'Profits shall be distributed as follows: X% to Rab al-Mal, Y% to Mudarib'
Example calculation showing how profit-sharing ratio applies in practice
Confirmation that contract template was previously approved by Shariah Board

policyConstraints.constraint: Profit-sharing ratio must be documented in writing before Mudaraba commences

steps.title: Both Parties Sign Mudaraba Agreement
steps.description: Rab al-Mal and Mudarib sign agreement confirming acceptance of profit-sharing ratio

requiredEvidence.description: Fully executed agreement with signatures from both Rab al-Mal and Mudarib
Both parties acknowledge understanding and acceptance of profit-sharing percentage

policyConstraints.constraint: Agreement must be signed before Mudaraba business operations begin

criticalNote: ⚠️ HARD GATE: If profit-sharing ratio is (1) not percentage-based, (2) gives 100% to one party, or (3) guarantees fixed return, the Mudaraba is INVALID per AAOIFI FAS-3 §3. This would be riba (interest) if fixed return is guaranteed.
